1P9lHHWi_s2k0k3GZB90bQ.text: Superb fish andchips! It's a small place but fine and quiet for a Sunday lunch together withyour family. For a great Fish and Chips experience, you really dovisit this restaurant. Generally, this is a pretty good place to get somedelicious and flavourful Fish and Chips in London, and I would absolutely comeback to grab some good take away.Eating fresh fish and chips in the finerestaurant is not the cheapest, but the value and complete ambiance all puttogether is a big deal.It is definitely the best fish 'n chips I've ever tasted .

CapSAcZ3K-gX1lqKvjWXJg.text: A bit over priced even for take away, but considering its' location and how busy it is I guess it's a tourist favourite. Nonetheless amazing fish and chips and great portions.

BiYh0wD0UJwul7zYMWkaUA.text: North Sea is the place where I was introduced to a proper Fish and Chips. We managed to catch North Sea minutes before the restaurant opens, which meant a trip right next door to their takeaway. If you're looking for a quick fix of fish & chips, the takeaway and not the restaurant is the way to go.I'm not a snob when it comes to breaded and fried fish as you could put a case of Van De Kamps in front of me and I'd have a whale of a time. However, I had great expectations for North Sea in London and fish & chips in general for that matter and still they managed to deliver in a big way.Their fish is huge, an actual fish fried on top of chips or steak fries as we call them in the States. We had the cod and the haddock and the taste test revealed the cod to be overall more tasty than the haddock. Still, both fish were a beautiful combination of fresh fish meat, the perfect heat, and the right amount of crisp in every bite. The chips? Well, they give you an entire funnel of them and the paper they wrap it in soaks up all the oil so you retain the texture of the fries as you eat your massive fish. That said, the fries could have been more crispy. The fish is the real star and fortunately I didn't come across any bones in my haddock. The cod had a few. It's definitely filling and worth every pound. Get it with tartar sauce (only 50 pence) and sit outside on their bench to enjoy.In nautical terms, getting the fish and chips at North Sea is like catching the 'big one,' and I'd recommend casting your line there as soon as you can.

yCbPEwn8m1sZh0znjyNZcw.text: For a great Fish and Chips experience, do visit this restaurant. It was conveniently located down the street from our hotel, so after our first (tiring) day in London, we settled down to a nice meal of f&c. They have several fish choices for your fish and chips- haddock, cod, salmon, form what I remember. The piece of fish they serve you is huge, and quite substantial for one person (I could have probably split one with someone!). The chips were crisp and thick, and when doused with vinegar and dipped in tartar sauce were phenomenal. Anyway, it was yummy intro to British food, and along with waters and a beer, it came out to be a bit over 50 pounds. Of course, dining out in London is quite expensive, but this was reasonable. The ambiance is very old school

Pa4K-rNKuB5lxNjsimkETA.text: Went there twice in 2 weeks and ate at the sit down restaurant both times.  The first time I had the haddock and the second time cod -- cod definitely won hands down.  Mushy peas could have used mint or some other flavor enhancer.  The blackcurrant sorbet was amazing & very refreshing.  Definitely looking forward to my next meal there.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. blackcurrant sorbet
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Cod in back and haddock in front - if this is regular what does jumbo look like!

Jq5afEkuGKkwq20er77bvA.text: Hubby and I used yelp while on vacay to London to find the best fish and chips place possible. And this place delivered! We barely snuck in at 1:40pm before their 2pm close time for their sit down restaurant and ordered the smoked haddock (so good!) as an appetizer so that we would not have an entire meal that was deep fried, haha. The we shared a large potion of fish and chips. To my surprise, instead of being many pieces of battered and fried fish, the entire fillet comes out as one huge piece! Fresh, fragrant, and steaming, not overly oily. The chips were pretty standard large cut fries, but with ketchup and malt vinegar they were the perfect accompaniment. :) About 30 pounds fed both of us a very nice, sit down lunch. (We were the only tourists and an older lady laughed at us for taking pictures with the food, haha.)

UUN9Vrk_RezwwsoygclrNg.text: Simple Fresh and Superb Food. Grilled Haddock and Skate done perfectly and very sublime. Boiled potatoes...yes they were also fresh and done just right. Service is not great, but who cares when the food is this good and it comes out HOT...my biggest beef with eating establishments. North Sea is not to be skipped. If I lived in London I'd eat here weekly. My mouth waters, just writing this review.

R6kvkZtFvWgRNfDFNeHchg.text: If you want a flaky deep-fried whole cod with some chips and british beer, this is the place to go in King's Cross.

yv26mdX8xJ7jt6WsIYjUog.text: I looked hard for  fish and chips restaurant before our London stay because it was too brief. This shop was just okay. Decor is a little tired. Service is as well. Haddock was acceptable; chips I'm sure were frozen. I would not make my way back to this chippie on future visits.

6pqT3DWlCeF2vvg9szjzDA.text: Not open during a holiday? Tourist neighborhood? Awful. Tried it the next day, undercooked fish, undercooked chips. Terrible experience,

OeXKHIDlnhspFQLau1aHwg.text: 4 of us walked in 30 minutes before closing and they smiled and made us feel very welcome. 3 of us had haddock and chips and 1 had the grilled Dover sole.  All very happy with the food. Excellent and friendly service at a very decent price.  Well worth the walk off the beaten path.

9JileojaT05q_s7RpxQNeg.text: Tucked away about 10 minutes walk from the bustling, over crowded Kings Cross, is this lovely, homey fish restaurant. I have been coming here since I was young, and for me I just get a feeling of comfort as it's a place which reminds me of when I used to come to London with my parents during my summer holidays.  However, even if it is your first time, the place simply engulfs you with a sense of familiarity and ease, and this could be due to the fact that not only is it unpretentious in anyway (except for maybe one of the waitresses who works there who can from time to time be quite off!), North Sea has been run and belongs to the same family since it first opened in 1977. This joint first started as a local fish and chip shop, but due to its popularity, and quite rightly so, it is now a restaurant with a take-away establishment right next door. The menu a nice array of fish, which you can have cooked in various ways, so as not to limit one to the usual battered fish. I last had grilled cod and chips with mushy peas. The cod was just the right texture, the chips were chunky and the peas where hot and the right kind of mushy! By the way, the portions are huge so unless you can handle it, I would recommend sharing the large portion of chips and sides they give you! Eating fish and chips at the restaurant itself is not the cheapest, but the quality and overall ambiance all put together is very pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Grilled cod, chips and mushy peas

ws5uW2_EziagQpjjgbbRuw.text: Very good fish but didn't quite feel the euphoria of other reviewers. Got the takeout -- in fairness the sit-down restaurant is a little less than twice the price  not 3 or 4 times price as some say -- and enjoyed a meal in Taverstock Sq. Definitely recommend this place but don't get expectations unrealistically high based on reviews that promise transcendental enlightment from fried codfish. Also had the green peas which were a nice complement -- something unfried -- to the rest.Thanks to all for putting a good recommendation on Yelp!

4xzt_WcauA9i5XqwCWXkNA.text: Before my family went on our vacation I had the help of one of TripAdvisors finest posters and as I wanted one of the best places to eat Fish & Chips (by British standards of course).  We found the spot located in a pretty cool neighborhood and when we arrived we were starving.  The place is simple and I like that.  All, I care about is having good fish & chips and good service.  The fish is so good and even though we were pretty cramped we figured out how to make it work.  It was fresh and it was cooked right, perfect batter and the chips were piping hot and good.  This time I decided to skip the alcohol but if I'm able to go there again--next time I wouldn't.  I would highly recommend tourist or local.

mzF7XPyfEuTUinyh87jxxg.text: The Cod fish and chips were awesome. I got the large while my wife got the regular. Just a couple pounds more get you a huge fillet.  Iconic fish and chips with nice cozy atmosphere!

WB-NTXzIS-q0E57nAcM-ew.text: We went twice - first time in May, 2008 and then returned in May, 2011.  We loved it both times.  An unassuming place, obviously a fan among the locals, neighborhood folks.  It's in the Bloomsbury section across the street from a garden square.  Right next door is a fish market.Fresh, tasty, nice presentation and nice portions - very laid back, with decent service.  Had fish and chips both times.

zSY4jp3B4v_JhcCg-OjkEQ.text: Hmmm... get take away or eat inside the restaurant for 4x the price?  I think I'll get the take away, thank you very much. The pieces of fish were HUGE, so I can't even image what the jumbo sized portions are like. I was greedy and ordered the large portion of chips, which were great and still tasty cold a couple of hours later. I liked the care in which the guy salted the chips and tossed them slightly before wrapping it up for take away. All in all, friendly staff and great fish and chips. After all, it's the healthiest meal for all the family, according to the print copy on the package!

ErJi3ZDfcIozQSkss-RTzw.text: Normally, I would take a star away for atmosphere, but this was such a good, juicy, huge piece of grilled haddock for only 15 pounds, that I didn't even look up from my plate to notice the surroundings. Look, it's an old school hole-in-the-wall, nothing much to look at. We may have been the youngest people in there. This is nowhere to take a date. In fact, while we were there, 4 single men came in and sat down to dinner alone. You're craving a good, simple piece of fish, right off the boat? This is your place. You're trying to impress a date? Maybe not. Unless she's a fisherman. Let's call it 4 1/2 stars.

qalWg9Vz93TSl49sbtf55A.text: Excellent fish and chips! It's a small place but nice and quiet for a Saturday lunch. I had the cod and the crust was light and crispy. Very nice! The chips were okay - a little too crispy for my taste. But overall a lovely meal.

IJ4zyaljsPQoi4CxuZTVmQ.text: We had the fish and chips from the takeaway and were able to share one order because of the large portions. My boyfriend doesn't care much for fish but he was liked it. Good stuff!

OCDhr0zqlX1nahHPAAgNLQ.text: We went to the take out place because I could not phantom paying £30 for the same piece of fish from the restaurant when I could have it for £5 from the take out place.   Maybe I made the wrong decision!  The stuff we got was bland and oily.  Only the fish roe was semi tasty.   I don't understand all the hype and will definitely not come back!

OUOc1YySv1giCxmSvpggfQ.text: I didn't know fish and chips until today. And a bottomless chips bowl. The cod was so crispy, not greasy at all. I Amazing and highly recommended. And don't leave without having the Bread and Butter pudding with cream. Felt like I was at someone's home. Such friendly service and cozy atmosphere.

sqGZh6q8yMjgIYm1d9rBoA.text: I have a friend/co-worker who likes tradition. And for him, it's all about the Fish and Chips on Friday. Now that we're working in central London we have more opportunities than just eating the food at the terrible canteen. I found North Sea and thought we should venture a bit further out to try some place new for Fish and Chips as the ones close by seem to be hit or miss sometimes. Fish and Chips places can be busy, so I was worried that there wouldn't be seated, but there's actually a huge dining space in the back of the restaurant. Which was a bit of a downfall because we got forgotten about a few times during lunch.The five of us ordered the fish and chips. So the fish was really tasty and crispy and the chips were amazingly crisp and delicious. They have homemade tartare sauce, and it was one of the best I've had. They weirdly serve the chips in baskets to share between two people. I'm not sure what that's about. Since there was an odd number of us, I got my own basket, so I didn't care.Unfortunately if you choose to eat in, it's a bit expensive. I wouldn't mind paying the price for a dinner out, but for lunch, it's unlikely I'll go back.

2UJDBu5mtehLaXjk03MwCA.text: Quaint little place (what place the area isn't?), with friendly, helpful staff, wide variety of really good fish/seafood, all at a decent price

Ksb0DVlZlZMAuofR6Lf4dQ.text: It was just ok. The service was a bit slow and inattentive. The fish was good, but pretty greasy. The prices for the quality didn't match up that well on the dining in side. I heard the take-away is the better option. Wish I would have chose that instead.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Jumbo cod!

UB9ct5VQZMhMWuj8qoNCow.text: We were staying close by this restaurant and Siri recommended it so we we gave it a try.  Did not realize that the standard fare is fried fish and French fries...fish and chips. We were very pleasantly surprised. There are about 10 choices for types of fish including Dover sole, cod, salmon, and halibut.  I don't know if the wait staff could tell we don't eat fried food or if we just made good choices, but we ended up with the daily special, a sea bass grilled with spring onion sauce and the grilled halibut.   Very fresh. Very yummy.  The fried fish delivered to neighboring tables looked fantastic.  It looked so good I almost envied there fried fish choices.  If you are in the mood for fish and chips, try here for sure.

VCKATg5mlNemfuJgruL5yQ.text: Takeaway food:Bland, but not oily, well cookedMust:Order tartar sauce on the side and additional sauces.

irJ0eqWl8I4ml3iJQnnrVQ.text: Fish. And lots of it. Fresh, grilled or fried. No preteritions. My new favorite spot when I want a good seafood meal near Kings Cross.

agg51NOOFm-oYw-67Ih3qA.text: Fresh and tasty fish and chips with generous tartare sauce on the side. This place is pricey but its well worth  every pence when my taste buds are satisfied. The cod fish that I had was flaky, tasty, fresh and pipping hot.  The restaurant itself was cozy and clean but the service was a-ok. The waitress gave off the vibe that she does not want to be there and was mostly on her cellphone texting/browsing the internet. It definitely dampen my experience but I was at least satisfied with my food. I will definitely come back or bring visiting friends and relatives here if they ask for good fish and chips.

9vvqZ99mdCwkYllNsZGsgg.text: Very good, freshly battered fish and chips. Fast service, reasonable price and pretty big portions. Service was a little cold, but highly recommended otherwise, especially due to the dearth of other options in the area.

qsF0PmYPe9r7SAzSduttiw.text: The North Sea Fish has always been one of my favorite restaurants in London. Extremely fresh and tasty fish! However, I was very disappointed this evening, since the waitress was extremely rude to us. It is still worth going for the food though!

ybLp_eIGHEQdA5nRH9ZM2Q.text: This is my 150th review and my first London review, and what better way to start by reviewing a place that serves an icon of British cuisine for the past 100 years or so: Fish and Chips. Located in the Bloomsbury neighbourhood of London, this place is divided into two sections, the restaurant section and a section for take away. My friend, his roommate and I went to the take away section because I noticed that getting fish and chips is cheaper.We got some Fried Cod and a good portion of Chips to share among ourselves. Since my friend's roommate is a devout Muslim from Oman, he wanted to make sure that the fish was prepared "halal" (he was very adamant about it), so we asked if they could prepare it "halal". The staff over there seemed to be happy and obliged to do so, but we had to wait longer compared to the typical patrons who wanted to get take away. So if you are Muslim, and want "halal" Fish and Chips, this is also a good option. After getting the fish and chips, I put some vinegar and salt on them, and started to eat. The fried fish was pretty tasty, the batter on the outside had a nice good crisp, while the fish itself was soft, and could be tastier with the Tartar Sauce. As for the chips, they were also pretty tasty. With the salt, the chips also had a good crisp that would make the chips almost addicting to eat. They use a lot of paper, which is supposedly the traditional way to wrap up Fish and Chips. The paper is fairly thick, so it's pretty good at absorbing the grease.Overall, this is a pretty good place to get some tasty Fish and Chips in London, and I would definitely come back to grab some good take away. And I did not have to spend more than £7 for a generous helping.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Cod and Chips - About 6.50
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Cod and Chips - About 6.50
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Take away section menu

O1at7hg3kgHY5NuFmLHdCQ.text: I had the fried calamari with chili sauce to start and traditional fish (halibut) and chips for my entree. Portions were great, food was fresh/hot and service was good. I would eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Traditional fish (Halibut) and chips with a great London pale ale.

6HZMPfRcjbag7PmqpKyOVA.text: I'm giving this place 4 stars with a caveat: the sides are horrendous, but the fish is so incredible and perfectly crispy yet tender that you won't care about the sides (i.e. mushy peas that looked like green soup and semi cold chips).As you sit in the restaurant you can literally hear others cutting into the fish, it's that crispy. It's a beautiful thing, and its cooked well, never overcooked. Get the haddock, you will not be disappointed! The atmosphere is a little bizarre but when it's busy it has a really quaint feel to it. They also have a to go place next door if you do not feel like sitting down.Also, best tartare sauce in the world!

LawVx5x-x9FCKu1U6Wm4sg.text: Fantastic fish & chips!  We had the Halibut.  It was huge, meaty and well battered.  The chips were perfectly shaped and cooked.  It's not cheap but it's worth it.

s_qw-W9h-LhTnylwFo8Iiw.text: Thanks to the Yelp community I tried this restaurant on my recent trip to London. I wasn't disappointed. The decor is old world, but well kept and perfect.  the food...amazing. I had the haddock fried of course. It was perfectly prepared. Light, fresh, excellent. The tarter sauce, while good, wasn't as good as expected after reading other posts. I will definitely return on my next trip. If for no reason other then a comfortable neighborhood restaurant with good service, full fish menu and excellent taste.  Give it a try.Would I stay here again? - YESWould I recommend to a friend or colleague? - YESIs it a good value for the money? - YES

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

HwSQVWmBpBwRhh_qmw4UWQ.text: So this is what great fish and chips are supposed to taste like. We are from the Los Angeles area and have never had such great tasting fish. It was crisp on the outside and tender and flaky inside. I just wish other restaurant  owners in the US could visit this place to find out what these Londoners are raving about.

PpHPh0iQY_ZXSjxXX7nnUA.text: Wow - great fish and chips. I called it Whale and chips when it arrived. Only problem we had with this place was the seating. Even though there were plenty of empty tables the sat us next to the toilets. Ugh. We should have just moved - sure - but they never should  have sat us there unless it was the last resort - and as i said, the place was far from full.  But yeah - great fish and chips.

5ihSV_5gHn_M5dGP83VBow.text: Excellent chippy near Russell Square. They offer a good variety of fresh fish. Takeaway is the value here. Make sure that you order it cooked fresh. They sometimes have the most popular fish sitting under the heat lamp. The skate is my favorite.

z_xcHUcHFWhPiuRbH-OT8Q.text: Awesome. I love this place. Good food, friendly service and I love the old school feeling of the decor :)

tmIKIcw0_EvHFjre5fj-ZQ.text: This is the best fish and chips I've ever had. I chose the jumbo fried haddock cuz I'm a hungry hungry hippo and had a cider to wash it down with. The fish is perfectly cooked; flaky and delicate. The fried breading was light and ultra crispy without being too crunchy. The chips are your standard steak fries and definitely need salt, vinegar and/or ketchup for extra flavor. But the star of the show is certainly the fish.The staff is very helpful and friendly despite having to deal with our rowdy touristy group. The dining space is very homey and comfortable. All future fish and chip meals will be compared to North Sea as the benchmark.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Dining room.
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. I ALMOST finished my jumbo haddock. My inner fatty thinks less of me now.
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Chips (2 portions for me and my friend's entrees).

B9OgoZwSaNuXRpYUOBB0Jg.text: We were tired from a lot of walking and I was in the mood for seafood, we checked Yelp from Kings Cross tube stop, and decided to give this a try. The food was very good and reasonably priced. My grilled sea bass was excellent, and my wife enjoyed the fried haddock with chips. Service was good, and the interior was nicely decorated. I'd recommend eating here if you're in the mood for fresh fish - lots of choices

9K1Ddo0ua7yg9dXkzMlyyQ.text: The other reviews nailed it. If you are looking for fish and chips this is the place. We split the jumbo cod and coke slaw and couldn't be happier with our choice.

FCRBpnrSb00Ws3FVw1nf8Q.text: We are in London so common sense requires us to go get fish and chips, fast. Destiny demands, we obey. Those are the simple lines of reasoning that can lead you to the best places, which themselves have crystal clear guidelines too ; for the North Sea Fish the motto is pure and perfect : "let's cook fish and chips but not with poor lonesome fillet but with quality WHOLE fish". As a total newbie of fish and chips - who has only in her sad existence came across pathetic pretence of them, - I was delighted by this superb food experience. The fish was delicious, well cooked and of high quality, not some Captain Cook fillet (oh what a newbie I am to invoke Captain Cook name along those sacred lines). The chips were really savory. Plus the sauce : three different types are brought to you (including a tartare sauce) so that you have the choice and they all are very tasty as well.So, was it greasy? You bet it was. What else to expect? But it was a delicious taste of fat. The fried breading was almost light (yep). But I need to admit that I was not able to finish my truly enormous dish, it is not only that I was not hungry anymore because I went far beyond that limit, I just could not physically eat anymore. Even the male company could not finish. Do not fear to leave the place hungry, rather fear that the place might eat you alive.Oh and the surroundings? I was so focused on the enormous fish that I did not pay much attention but it was quite nice, very British. And the service was very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Scotch salmon fish and chips
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

VlrtstlZAJqwN5YGHeOQkg.text: One of the best authentic fish and chip restaurants around. Fresh fish, fresh fried food unlimited Refills on chips. It gets busy in here and it's warm but worth it if you want the real deal. Take away options too

-D_QzPTnvkWbOJkCzjJv9Q.text: Fish was fantastic but the service was horrible.  I guess when tipping isn't standard the service turns to shit.  My cocktail glass was broken and when I brought it to their attention, you would have thought I broke the glass myself.  Our cocktail and food order was wrong and had to go back twice.  Wake up zombie!

9G_yAA5mid8ZbeeZ8bS7EQ.text: Been here twice plus a take away order next door, and I've only been to London twice so far. Actually, I suppose that says it all right there! Fish has been superb each time, and I love the zest of horse radish in their tartar sauce - I've started doing that at home. Staff was friendly on both sides of the house. Sit down service is suitable for business dinners or other more formal engagements, but relaxed enough for every day.

OUtJg03BrSyQii6NmuCH2A.text: The take out line was too long so we changed our plans to just get fish and chips for the hotel room and grabbed a seat inside instead.  I had one of the specials, which was a tuna steak in a sweet/spicy pepper sauce which was awesome.  My wife opted for just the avocado prawn salad appetizer and it was really good too. Nice atmosphere and service was good.  No complaints,

_-vYBH2kPRbl5efyfJRsEg.text: Our first night in London, we popped in to North Sea Fish Restaurant for dinner.  We sat down, our waitress brought us a drink and took our order, and then we literally never saw her again.  Someone else brought out the actual fish, and we never saw him again.I eventually wandered up to the front of the restaurant to get someone to give me the check, and got the heck out of there.But the fish was so.  freaking.  good.  I cannot express to you in English how good this fish was.  Or Spanish ... but I digress.The point is, that this fish was fresh, crispy, goodness of epic proportions.  And when I figured out the secret of North Sea Fish Restaurant, my time in London was amazing.The secret is this: Order it to go.  Let them wrap it in paper, with chips and vinegar, take it back to your hotel/hostel/b&b/street corner, and eat it straight from there with beer and a soccer game on where you may or may not know any of the rules.  This is the standard for all fried fish going forward, henceforth and forevermore.So this is five star food and one star service.  Don't bother with sitting down, just take advantage of the wonderful, incredible food.

Pcx7i3Cm-J0nR_-1nTlgmQ.text: The fish and chips were everything other reviewers claimed they were. Delicious! The owners were incredibly kind, and overall our experience here for dinner was fantastic. Highly recommended!

Lo4TgkjCE23QjvUvkB-0oQ.text: My husband said this is the best fish and chips he has ever had! I thought the skin on the fish was a little odd and chewy, but the flavors were top notch. Super yummy and highly reccomended. The portions are huge. We are fluffy people and could probably have split a normal size.

FxSFcnyde4niYIltl-udBA.text: Just packed when we walked in, but they found a seat for the 6 of us.  The service (German woman) was a little slow, perhaps because of how busy it was.  The food was tasty, I had the fried Haddock and chips.  My wife and father in law had the sea bass which they did not like much.  The choices were limited due to New Years and the fish markets being limited in supply.  My 2 boys ate off the kids portions and loved the fish cake and the fish and chips.  The owner came by and was very nice.  Spent time with us and was very friendly.  I would go back and had an overall positive experience.

5JnTaVckgGwFK4Me1JO6hA.text: Enjoyed our first meal in London at this tasty establishment. Fish, chips, and a good beer was a must and they delivered! The cod was fresh, flakey, tasty, crispy. I had the potatoes and glad for my choice. The service was friendly, prompt and great recommendation on the Spitfire beer!

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Our fish and chips and potatoes plates!

-w8EeqEagOe_UvfGc1Zwlw.text: This is rating the takeaway joint.Have I become a fish and chip snob?  I was a little underwhelmed.  I do agree with the other reviews saying the fish is fresh, tender etc... but it was very bland even with salt and vinegar.  I got take away on a Monday and the chips tasted like they were fried the friday before and heated up.  Now the American I am love a lot of ketchup.  It's either 50p for a small packet or 80p for a small bottle.  Really?There are better places out there.  Yeah it's cheap at first but after you add up all the little stuff like ketchup and tartar sauce.  There are better places in town for Fish & Chips.

Blz4410YTWoLyHFvGsof-Q.text: Fresh fish every dayGreat little neighbourhood feelIs worth searching for.

fT_UNeFfvo_JpLHHhQis4w.text: This is a very classic and upscale fish (& chips) restaurant! They have numerous fish options available that you can order battered and fried or grilled. There are also several non-fish options like soups that are very tasty if you don't love fish! I completely recommend this place for a nice, quiet lunch. It is authentic and delicious!

CKxHhiIgmvymS4imrZTErw.text: We arrived a little early, so we were forced to takeaway. I ordered cod and chips. The fish was fresh and still had the skin. The exterior of the fish was perfectly crunch. The fries were a bit soft for my liking; especially, in comparison to the  crunchiness of the fish.The presentation was unique. I asked for it to be open so that I could eat it as we walked (as opposed to closed). They made a cone out of the paper that would have been used to wrap the fish if I had asked for it to be closed. A large chunk of fries was thrown into this cone, and it was topped off by the fish plumped on top.

o43A04YhSrYt6-cc49lrqg.text: It is the best fish & chips I had. Mind that the place is separated between take away (cheap!!) and dining in (not that cheap). I had plaice in egg matzo coating. It was basically fried in batter, but it was light, crispy and not oily at all. The batter puffs up so it looks like your portion of fish is HUGE, but it's not, the regular portion is just big enough to satisfy a standard hunger. Side spinach, coleslaw and pickled onion were all good. They also serve everything with ketchup bowl and tartar sauce bowl - free of charge.The service was friendly and very attentive (it helped that we were the only people in the restaurant! - it was their first opening on a Sunday). I liked the ambiance of the place - very cozy, wooden furniture, dark red seating - good space.I just wish it was a tad bit cheaper - it's twice/thrice more expensive comparing to its sister take-out next door.

EtUM2NXpQKQv9UPmQ3ta4A.text: Note, there are two sides to this Restaurant. There is the 'take away' side, which is quite a bargain, and then there is the full service sit down side. We wanted to sit and have a few pints, so we sat. Unlike in the states, you get one large chunk of fish here and not several smaller pieces. Service wasn't quick, but the fish was tasty and batter crispy to my liking. My skate had a lot of cartilage, which I enjoy, but I find most people don't.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The skate was large and tasty, but full of cartilage.

8XjLLMGv88YrHZIuUdhxaw.text: Got the fish and chips to go, since I was staying  literally on the same block. It was ok. Hard to tell how long the fish had been sitting out under the lamps, and it was soggy by the time I took it out minutes later. So probably best to just eat it there. Cod fillet has bones, so watch out for that.

CdADTRc-QLeMFwNSQg8Ygw.text: Back in England so time for fish and chips. Battered coating was crisp but not greasy and the fries were bottomless. Service was very good and friendly.

4H8vimh1Qde0zrsVv1JXHw.text: Our group was not really impressed with this restaurant. I ordered the sweet potato pot pie. For one thing, it was served so hot that after ten minutes into cutting into it, I still burnt my mouth when I took a bite, to the point of instant blistering. The taste was just ok. There was an odd spice in it that just didn't sit right with me. My friend had the sea bass that came recommended. He said he's had much better, and the side of boiled potatoes had no flavor. My fiancé had the fish and chips (cod). He was served a huge portion, but I tasted it and thought it was just good, not great. Honestly the best thing we tasted were the chips. Service was below average as well.

rKUMmD4F3F__qfGeQp2mDA.text: You can't go wrong if you chose to eat here and you really should chose North Sea Fish. I ordered the fish n chips and was very impressed with the portion size and taste of the fish. Yum! Service waa good and fast.

rEOd6CW7PjDNqx1AdO5wNQ.text: The food was not as good as we wanted it to be.  The place is very nice inside.  It was air conditioned which was really nice as today it was hot in London.  Service was professional and fast.  We got halibut and cod prepared with a batter and chips. The chips were really good.  And the tartar sauce was good.......But.... the fish...  Both filets were cooked well.  The Halibut was dry in places though.  And there was no real flavor anywhere.  WE ate our fill but there was no humming that usually accompanies eating good fish and chips.  So.... it was ok but we will not be back.

6NyWlUzKu1ofuGw-geSgtw.text: Have been here twice. Best fish and chips I have had in London. Of course there are grilled fish options as well and the fish always fresh tasting and perfectly prepared. North Sea has the best tarter sauce with horseradish forward taste. Excellent and overall food deserving of 5 stars

iUpJWZym_fBG6umSEmdpXg.text: This place is amazing. Fish and chips. Not greasy. Superb. I will dream of the this meal. Again and again. Oh and the bread pudding was equally awesome. Go there. You will not be disappointed. Yum

45bDicMnid8yIKz2AZIbMg.text: Food alone I might give the fish and chips 5 stars. The batter was light but still crispy and the fish was flaky. The chips really good as well. The service wasn't too friendly.  Very curt and to the point. Fortunately she acted like that to a couple who came in to make reservations so made me feel a little less bad about it

4ZRZdHLcdSBMdp017U8XFQ.text: Best fish and chips ever. Ate in the restaurant, but had takeaway on a previous visit. Great place in a homey neighborhood.

WbMG8IWHFzqlhHjkXEZx5Q.text: This is a very nice restaurant close to the British Library and to Skoob, best second-hand bookshop in London.  I wished afterwards that I'd ordered the Dover sole, which I gather comes as a whole fish on the bone, but instead I got a haddock fillet, fried in matzo meal crumbs instead of the thick and nasty beer batter you usually get.  Eat it at a table, on a plate and with a fork, instead of takeaway.  I got broccoli on the side which was OK, a little undercooked by British standards.  Very good service.

nmJcBu4G-O73310USoeSVg.text: This place is known for its fish and chips, so emphasize grilling if you don't want fried food. It's not very expensive and offers healthy portions. It's a fish restaurant and delivers for the most part. The service was a bit surely. It was raining but the place provided a welcome shelter for a couple of hours. The storefront next to the restaurant offers takeout--business looked brisk.

KprBTq_gHRDZAS-TD3zvrg.text: I went here and got the fish(cod) and chips. Everything looked beautiful. The problem was the taste. Fish wasn't seasoned at all and fries seem to be fried in old grease. I was the second one in the restaurant after they opened back up at 5:00...(no excuse for old grease taste). Won't be going back.

eLmMZyA_Ks5HK02Y87eUgQ.text: The restaurant is separated into a dine in and take away.  I got a cod and chips for take away.  The fried cod had a nice batter.  I wanted a packet of vinegar because it would have made my food soggy had they put the vinegar on when I ordered the food.  As a result the food was bland.  I think it would've tasted better had I eaten there.  However the take away prices are lower.

RIAAI6nvMdO9OQxDu9joqw.text: I'm not an everyday eater of fish and chips. It has to be really good to tempt me and this totally fit the bill. Fresh, hot, crispy, flavorful flounder. Chips were also decidedly tasty and crispy. Excellent tartare sauce. Generous portions. Side of runner beans was just right. My companions onion rings were also terrific, as was my half-pint of pilsner. Not a fan of the mushy peas, but I never am.

9lh87UZLaQkVeCrmVzqI9Q.text: Excellent service! We had a brief (less than five minute) wait. He service was excellent. Portion sizes are HUGE! Bottomless chips is a nice perk (although we did not need any additional food). My husband had fish and chips (cod), but there's a variety of options for fish and chips. I had the breaded scampi and chips. Both meals were amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

t3ejYH2besl1dAyZC3VeEA.text: Tried the daily special. Tuna steak with vegetable sauce. The tuna was fantastic and flavorful. A good amount of spices were in each bite. The ran out of boiled potatoes for the day, so I tried the chips. Quite crispy and tasty. For drinks, I tried some cider. A bit pricey but goes well with the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Tuna Steak and cider

WnlPM20ST1AotsZ7baogUw.text: One of the best fish and chips I ever had. Went for the Jumbo size; seriously massive portion.

YVz8POlP_FeMLSVVy0-4HQ.text: Some of the best I've had, glad we decided to make the mini journey. Made my daughter a fan and they do it old school here.75p extra for under £10 if not cash, but no issues with that....

nlo0aYfVgKxWhywGMyh8-A.text: Lovely restaurant with friendly staff! Haddock fillet was delicious, and chips were perfectly done. Steak and Stilton pie  was great as well. Casual atmosphere, with top class cuisine. 10/10, would highly recommend.

QBU7xi2aKvZ-bTi2IvmmZQ.text: 3.5 stars but +.5 because of their take away box :)Very standard fish and chips shop. Everything you would expect. When you ask for take away you can get it open or closed. They wrap it up in a newspaper like bag and you can carry the whole thing your hand. Awesome.

Kb3TPmEHdwQjNkN3b1Ahfw.text: Pretty great haddock and halibut. Huge portions of fish; chips are on the house if you dine in. Good for takeout, too.

tPye7JTWzi19Zeu_WPP9sQ.text: We've been craving fish and chips ever since we decided on taking holiday in London and this place definitely did not disappoint. We got the fried haddock and chips. Fish was fried to order as it came piping hot. Large filet of fried fish perfect for two! My fiance loved the tartar sauce that came with the fried haddock. I preferred the fish with a squeeze of lemon and malt vinegar. Chips were perfectly crispy, great to dunk into the tartar sauce as well. We also got the grilled seabass with a side of boiled potatoes. Sounds simple and it was, but it stands out as one of my favorite meals in London so far. A entire fish perfectly grilled. Filet it on your own with, fish comes off the bone with ease. Small squeeze of lemon was all it needed, if any. This dish was perfection. I love this place. Small intimate restaurant, great service, amazing food.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Grilled seabass. Delicious
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Fried haddock and chips!

u_h8RZhyQsWV7_zIjNJd0w.text: Large Portions of Fish, unlimited bottomless fries. Pretty packed when we got here, but luckily we scored a table. There was a couple in front of us that was waiting when we got there, but we both got seated at the same time. Additionally, other people were turned away after we got the last spot. Basically must make reservations especially since place is so small. This place is as good as it gets for bang for the buck. If I had been a little hungrier, I definitely could have taken advantage of the bottomless fries. GF ended up getting the cod, while I got the large haddock. I don't recommend getting the large as I didn't see much different in size between the small and the large.Cod: GF found some tiny bones in the cod, so she didn't seem to enjoy it.Haddock: Wow this thing was amazing. The fish was overly oily, which made the fish fry/batter lose some crispiness, but it was still super yummy. I could definitely feel the fats and oils settling in while I ate. Still would recommend this place.Fries: Can't so no to bottomless fries now can I?

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Fries and fish
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

uO4pIto3Zr0U9c79T4ODGA.text: This was on several best of lists for fish and chips in London so the bf and I decided to check it out. I got the haddock while he got the cod. There were a few tiny bones in both which made me kinda paranoid the rest of the meal but nothing large enough to leave a mark. The chips are unlimited but after our first serving we were already full-- they were also DELICIOUS!!!If I could redo the experience I probably would have tried a different type of fish. However since haddock is the typical go to for fish and chips I figured it was the way to go. This was a tad pricey but the area is far from a typical pub setting. I'm sure there is type of fish that could push my rating up!

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Haddock and cod
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips!

NtMW-yLgLH0qX-64IwDJIg.text: I have never been a huge fish and chips fan, but of course had to have some while visiting London. This place has ruined me for life. The best fish and chips I have ever had. The batter was light and not greasy at all. The fish was perfect on the inside. The tartar was delicious which I think must of been homemade too. They even have a take out section next store.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Outstanding fish and chips
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Ketchup and tartar

I6cHUSAgnVfkOVNX8kb5SA.text: Very good cod fish and chips, steamed broccoli and  an apple crumble with Vanilla ice cream for dessert. Nice and comfortable ambiance. Recommend.

RKNVKWw0jpurJMoRNnHHlw.text: We have our dinner here last night. I thought I have to taste the English fish and chips while we are here in London. The smell of fish as we enter the restaurant is quite overpowering. Thanks goodness my built in olfactory defence kicks in or else I would not be in there for long. The service was good. I ordered the haddock chip and my partner ordered grilled sea bass. I was pleased with my order. The chips batter is light and the fish is fresh. My partner's order was also very tasty. I probably eat there again.

5_fRfhWdKpOSncHb7cTL9g.text: During my weeklong visit I visited North Sea Fish Restaurant twice!  This was my first stop after arriving as well as my last stop before departing.  On my first visit I arrived for a late lunch on a Saturday.  They were about to close for the mid day break.  There were a few other people there but in general it was fairly quiet.  I ordered a regular order of the cod with chips.  A regular is a plenty big portion, let me tell you!  The homemade tartar sauce was fantastic.  It had a slick kick from horseradish and I loved it so much I started to dip my chips into it.  The fish was really fresh and light.  They did such a good job frying it that there didn't seem to be any evidence of grease.  The chips are bottomless but the portion is so generous I have to wonder who can make it through one basket.  Yes, they are really good.On my second visit, I came with two work colleagues who wanted fish and chips, badly.  This time I ordered this mixed seafood platter, which came with a variety of fish and seafood, and chips.  I was very pleased with the quality of the fried seafood, as were my dining companions, who both come from towns that have a lot of seafood.The menu contains a wide variety of fish cooked in different ways (e.g. grilled, fried, etc.) and with different breading.  There is more than just fish on the menu so I would consider this a seafood restaurant than a fish and chips shop.  There is a  take out storefront next door but lack of any place to really sit and eat it nearby.  Service was better on my second visit than my first.  One waitress seemed to be a bit more friendly with some patrons vs. others.  Seating can be a bit tight so be prepared for noise when it's a full room.  I would highly suggest reservations for the dinner, esp. on Fridays, which they said was their busiest time.

l6dfqIg90DwR4mgV1LsbGA.text: Came by for some last minute fish before leaving London. The food quality was solid. This family owned venue was full of locals. They have a good and unique selection of beers as well. The floor is a bit slippery, maybe from the oil, not sure. It was strange. Service was decent, but we did have to wait a while to get the check.

PRy-qfYsokXVMGqscIp1Sg.text: Great fish and chips and many other delightful fish dishes. Great, friendly service, and a nice wine list to boot.

rA-kXqDs5FbMAblQp9nlzA.text: If you're looking for fried fish and chips, this is the place. They have both takeaway and sit down areas and both are super popular. We showed up right before they closed to prep between lunch and dinner so the sit down area was quiet. People were stopping by already to reserve tables for dinner and the takeaway was busy the whole time we ate. My husband and I ordered the jumbo order of fried haddock and fries. Apparently the fries are endless but we were so full from the massive filet of fish we didn't need it. The fish was friend with the skin on still which was interesting and it was perfectly crispy and juicy. The fries were piping hot and delicious. The tarter sauce had a good bite to it but I found I liked the fish best with just some lemon and a dash of vinegar. Service was polite and I can't speak to the vibe because of the time of day. Across the street there's a pub that was popular and could be good for pre/post dinner drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

M5XsNCe-RKiJtug-9D2gEA.text: The best fish n chips around London. Large portions at a very reasonable cost. All food is freshly prepared. Fried items are not greasy. I have eaten at many places in London, but this has to my best food experience when I visit. Service can get a little slow when busy but the waitresses do try their best.Be aware that meat pies take 30 minutes to make but it is worth the wait. Delicious! They also take reservations.

Y0t-g9ACUoffOyPSMjpD-A.text: Best fish and chips I think I've ever had!  They were closing up when I walked in, but still seated me and made sure I had proper service.The food was FANTASTIC.  Typical American, I asked for my fish well don (extra fried) - which I think adds a crisp that a lot of fish and chip joints are lacking.  I should have gotten the large, but got the jumbo which is probably enough for two people.  The fries were also solid.If you're in the King's Cross area of London, this.is.the.spot.

71qV5mAdWE6AQveWOFGXnQ.text: Wow this is my new favourite UK chip shop style fried fish I've had. I ordered the Haddock, Scampi, & Homemade Tartare Sauce via Deliveroo. The batter was just as light and crisp as one could hope for and the fish tasted extremely fresh, despite the fact that I ordered on a Tuesday after a long Bank Holiday weekend. North Sea has surpassed Poppies by a long shot...

J5YsZ4HmtFXxCo5g8jGsrg.text: When a old friend suggested a reunion dinner at a fish and chip restaurant, my first thought was 'really?!?'  But all my qualms were for naught as this was a great place for a fish meal!You can get the old standards here of cod and chips but it's the other fish options that are the stars. You can actually get whole fish on the bone (woo hoo!), either battered or grilled. I got the grilled lemon sole which was a monster whole fish that was perfectly cooked. No dry overcooked fish here! The main drawback here is the service. We got a few smiles from a couple of the waitstaff but it's mostly surly, grumpy, 'why are you bothering me' attitudes.  The back room also got uncomfortably warm. It was packed on a Friday evening so reserve in advance, preferably a table at the front of the restaurant.  It's a great, tasty spot for really well prepared fish (and chips!)

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Grilled lemon sole

XkXqxAjosaKHdMdzoQ5bRg.text: Wonderful experience. Fabulous food. And of course one would never go home hungry from here. Freshest fish ever - we're headed back for a second time in a week in London. The pictures tell it all.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

ECH1BwYoaH6D7TQlr5ihsg.text: The jumbo fish is really big.We got to the restaurant at 7pm and the waiter (super nice) told us that they probably would not be able to seat us until 9pm. Two couples were turned away in front of us as well. The restaurant looked nice and traditional inside. Just next door is their take away location, which is apparently much cheaper than their eat in menu. We ordered cod and haddock, as well as chips. They had chips and a few pieces of fried fish available and ready for purchase but we had to wait 15 minutes while they prepared and fried our cod and haddock. This was worth the wait as the fish was piping hot when we got it. We didn't want to walk all the way to our hotel so we ate it sitting on a small bench right outside the restaurant.During the 20 minutes we were eating, there were probably 30 people coming in and out to order take away. Some locals ordered just chips, which they had the option of adding salt to. We ate the cod first, which was very meaty and tender. We knew the fish was fresh and not frozen by the way the meat was falling off each other. The haddock had a much fishier taste and less tender than the cod. I'm glad we got a chance to eat both. The chips were so good!

wcgJcVPkNbwWZOBZn-I-PA.text: I went wanting some fish and chips and it was superb. I got a medium size and it was about a foot long of cod fish!! Fries were good as well with vinegar and salt. They have great home made tartar sauce. (It is extra) However when we went only the take out part of the restaurant was open so it was a struggle to find somewhere to eat it. Luckily we found park close by.

gcXsXb9EEjBDEMe51VbsmA.text: Had this place bookmarked before even coming to London.  Had to say that it meet its expectation.  Got here around 8pm on a Thursday night and was seated right away.  The place was pack with only a table for 2 left.  Eventually, a bigger table opened up and we were moved because the area they seated us in was a little inconvenient.  Ordered the cod filet and the haddock filet.  Both came out delicious.  The haddock one had a little more flavors than the cod one. Both came with chips (fries) or boiled potatoes and we got one of each.  Both was also good!  The fish was a good size...they give you a while half of the fish. Beware what you order here... if you don't want the fish head and bones in your fish, make sure you order something that says filet on it... otherwise you will get the whole fish.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Filet Fish
Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

tnlZmA7PH9XYr0OeobvMGQ.text: THOROUGHLY enjoyed my experience here. We had just arrived in London and wanted classic fish and chips. So happy to have found this place where "classic" is taken up several notches. They have the classic cod fish, but the menu here is vast with tons of great options. You're going to have a hard time selecting between all their amazing fish choices. I wouldn't call this a "fish and chips" restaurant, but a solid seafood restaurant. The serving sizes here are ample. More than ample, huge. I opted for the classic cod and chips. It was perfectly fried and tender. I couldn't finish my fish and I barely made a dent in my chips because there was so much. It didn't help that we also had a couple of their appetizers to begin with: homemade fish cake and the deep fried brie. Both absolutely delicious. My sweet side craving a little something something, I opted for the trifle. It was good, but didn't blow my mind. It was my first time eating trifle, though, so this may just be a dessert that I'm not crazy about. Service was great. Friendly and knowledgeable staff willing to answer any questions us Americans had about traditional English food. I would most definitely recommend to any seafood lover.

b2PQh__UtpecrLloyHlybA.text: Amazing food in a cute little place with a super nice staff! The fish and chips are the best I've ever had, with bottomless chips and amazing tartar sauce. You should also try their slaw, it goes great with the fish. I can't recommend this place enough!!

p7-ECiybytupy4wjL4HQnQ.text: Got take away from their chippy next to the restaurant.  I was very disappointed. The fish was soggy - the chips were ok  Maybe I should have insisted on having them drop a fresh piece of fish into the fryer.  Not the worst ever, but I definitely would not venture out of my way to go back.

d9_eEFP-WWUZr9rG2TIJfg.text: Been going here for more than 10 years and since I have moved away I always visit when in London.Fish is fresh, chips are excellent.  Inexpensive you wont be disappointed.

2kyZOnQBKgAmUa-3RfWZJg.text: A genuinely nice place to have lunch or just a coffee with very friendly(but not overly) staff and a nice quiet garden and patio its the perfect place(if your in the are) to a tea or a light lunch or even one of their marvellous pizza.Although called 'pizzeria' they serve a variety of things from English fry ups and tea to baguettes to rice and pasta dishes (not just Italian food) as well as great pizzas.Seem to be open all the time. They're very very reasonably priced and have the money orientated attitude most chain shops carry around.Its 2mins from Kings X station so i would heartily recommend anyone having to wait on a train to make there way around there.

rqbjawQt0YutTc9JWmN4Tg.text: I love north sea for all the ways it isn't upscale London.  It's a cozy, worn a little around the edges, perfectly personal little restaurant tucked just far enough from a tube stop to make it feel like a local experience.  I never miss it when I'm in London- this oasis is just a short neighborhood walk away on a cold rainy day.

Cbzyw47qrWMwrwW5IDpA2Q.text: I've been here a few times and every time I've had to wait far too long for a simple fish and chips. The staff barely speak English and for the price, the fish is very poor quality. The fish still contains bones, it still has the silver skin and it's very dry. Not nice at all.

gGUvBa0YaAdjMte7nnfg6A.text: The North Sea Fish Bar is located in-between Kings Cross and Russell Square and is one of the best chip shops in the area, a definite cut above other vendors on Euston Road. It's often busy but the queues are always small and service is very quick and efficient. As chips go they're much better than any from a fast food outlet (even Burger King chips) and the portions are always very healthy. The chips are frozen and not freshly prepared but some of the best in this field. I've tasted the fish and I haven't always been happy - sometimes soggy and falling apart but the sausages is always good. If your live or are staying nearby its well worth the visit but perhaps not worth travelling if you don't.

photos.caption: Photo of North Sea Fish Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

1dGUskGBUCJNYnhXERejDg.text: I like North Sea. I didn't like it so much today when I went there and it was closed and then started raining, but considering how local it is, it is first choice when we consider fish & chips.The chips are tasty and the fish (I usually go for cod) is fine, although sometimes it has a strange aftertaste that I can't quite plaice...Eh hem.There is a sit down area too for those that like to be surrounded by pensioners and very dated decor, but the food comes out faster from the takeaway and is of the same quality, so there is no real point in going there unless you have traveled some distance for the experience, which I would find a little surprising in all honesty, but there you go.I can't not recommend, but I also hear good things about the Golden Hind which is only a ten minute walk away and has good reviews. North Sea is perfectly adequate, but sometimes I just find myself wanting a little more.

U1EYRzRQK1diKVzTdpuYvw.text: Brilliant fish and chips with a huge variety of fish. Eat in or take away. Having grown up in a seaside town, it's the only place I'd dream of buying F+C in London. Go. Now. No, seriously, GO.

USi6-z7q7r5LorDpDPONpA.text: Tucked away in a little side street is this gem of a place. Don't let your eyes deceive you! It's a REAL fish & chips place! You actually get to choose what kind of fish you would like, and you can have it fried or grilled. And the fries are nice and plump! Luckily, I live right around the corner so take-away is the always the cheaper alternative.

u0AMGeXVrA3cEYvDJQU5Tw.text: By London standards, this is an excellent chippy. Unusually, there's a wide choice including grilled fish. BTW, it's a restaurant and a take-away.

3mubtPIN9t6_M-q-mKM2mg.text: A few years ago, I lived upstairs of North Sea and have fond memories of this part of London. You get to choose your fish. I was a vegetarian at the time, but I did enjoy their excellent chips.

axYQxIMa667wGcqTU5mJdQ.text: I've always refused to eat fish and chips. Why should I eat greasy pan-fried English fish with French (?) fries? Well, this time, it's different. North Sea Fish is not a simple Fish and chips. You can call it a fish restaurant. It really deserves it. They've got a huge fish menu. All fish are freshly caught. My friend Piotr had a sea bass in a sorrel sauce. I had a grilled jumbo sized plaice with tartar sauce... and French fries of course. Everything was delicious and fresh. As a dessert we ordered a pineapple pudding and a crème caramel. The pudding was kind of exotic but nothing to remember of. The crème caramel though reminded me my childhood and I'm thankful for that. The décor is full of nostalgia with its wood-paneled bar and its cheap serviettes. Our polish middle-aged waitress was very kind and professional. It's located not far from the British Museum. I think it's a nice place to have lunch. The portions are big, it's very tasty and not expensive.

bA6kcJDA2fXjmV_1Q-3jwQ.text: This place is little harder to find for a tourist but definitely worth it.  I went here on my last day of the trip.. and wishing I started my trip here instead.  Absolutely the best Fish & Chips.  Crisp, moist, flavorable.  There is no place like it.

3sG1GpafsP4e40vswylX2A.text: Fantastic! Don't look at the menu just ask for jumbo fish and chips deep fried and a beer! Also, home-made tartar sauce is truly delicious.

DLPyI2Sp-Ewx8HFsMGIJWg.text: Excellent food and a great atmosphere - I'm sure the take away is good too, but the sit-down restaurant is larger and nicer than I was expecting given some of the other reviews. Highly recommended!

qq-b1ch9Ig4qZNx0bFwsoQ.text: 10 words...fried perfectly, huge pieces, chips dynamite, get take away always

f57T1TcdBSE2B5f1NI4gAg.text: Used to really like this place, but quality has gone down quite a lot recently. On most recent visit I ordered scampi, but when it arrived it turned out to be processed fish in breadcrumbs. The manager told me that this is what scampi was supposed to look like.

A_fqzseXcpRWv8B_OD2V4Q.text: I used North Sea's take out and it was great! I especially loved that they have a "half fish and chips" option - which is perfect for someone like me who has trouble finishing copious amounts of fried food. Not that they skimped at all, I could barely finish it - the portions were still large and the fish was delicious at the perfect price of £3.50 for half and around £5.50 for a full Cod fish and chips takeaway. 100% delicious, and friendly service. Will go back again, most definitely.

dh-yGuiHopsUxbs2JD_-dQ.text: The chips and battered sausage here were greasy even by fish and chip shop standards, but then this is how I remember chips shop fare being when I was growing up. I hadn't even realized that the chips I normally have in London were a little different to the ones from back home until I came here. Not bad.

BE7Krnb0MlXRgSANyPfNZw.text: Definitely the best fish 'n chips I've ever had.  I make sure to stop at North Sea Fish Restaurant every time I'm in London, and order the cod!

wXT9z43L5xyCvsLT5xs9oA.text: I guess this place was alright for Fish and Chips.  I'm not really a fish and chips person but thought i try it anyway since it is suppose to be the best place for Fish & Chips in London.  I got takeaway.  The service at takeaway was okay.  Not much of a talkative crowd.Paid 13 pounds I thought this still was a bit pricy for fish& chips but supposedly cheaper than dinning in.

X4_LZtIv_gAB-hQqQTRPFA.text: What am I rating?The eerily '70s-style fish restaurant fittingly packed to the gills with Old Age Pensioners or the take-away chip shop hailing under the same name next door?Walking into the sit-down restaurant, I felt as if I entered a time warp rivalled only by episodes of the Twilight Zone.  The tables, the chairs, the carpet, the pictures on the walls, the paper placemats on the salmon-coloured linen tablecloths, it left me wondering if the vibe was affected or just genuinely left over from 1977.The service was slow but competent.  The fish was tasty but, strangely, not as tasty as the take-away fish I could get next door for half the price.  The chips came in a communal basket, and, perhaps I'm just greedy, but I like to have my own allotment of life-sustaining fried potato, thank you.The bill was eye-poppingly high in comparison to the same fare served up at the adjoining take-away area, albeit patrons there would not have the joy of dining alongside the octogenarian crowd (nothing against them, of course...)The take-away, however, offers great fish and chips at great prices.  I arrived one night and just wanted a fish cake, but was quickly told they didn't have any because of the late hour.  While I was about to go full hog and get a full cod and chips, another employee spoke up and said they'd fry one up in a couple minutes.  Now that's service.To clarify, I decided to rate the restaurant proper.  Chip shop next door, you get four stars.

LRTpFkADTOVxfI_gmYJ1UQ.text: How can I come to London and NOT have fish and chips. That's like going to NYC and not having bagels. Menu is fairly straight-forward: Choose your fish, and choose your size. Joe and I went with the smaller size and ordered one cod and one haddock. It seemed slightly blasphemous to do anything else. Sure, they had salmon and sea bass but I figured I would go with one of the classics.Batter wasn't very heavy, it was the perfect amount. The chips were nice and crisp, but soft in the middle (just the way I like it). The homemade tartar sauce was oh-so-good, mix with a little malt vinegar, and I was in heaven!If you don't feel like dining in, there's takeaway located right next door. Service is good but nonchalant. Even though this was the only place we came to for fish & chips while in London, I can say that it was a favorite. Here's a conundrum for you: The table across from us, ALL ordered steaks. Why would you go to a restaurant called North Sea FISH Restaurant and order Steak!?!? Please let me know if you can solve this one because I just can't figure it out.

b1BKGBIr5VxeXLRwIHx-jQ.text: I heard about how temperamental fish and chips can be, so before I even left for England I did my research and knew I must check this place out. A tip for future visitors, check what time you head here since it is closed for a couple hours between lunch and dinner.  I happened to come during this closed period, but knew I wanted it bad enough that I walked all the way back on another day.Yelp has not let me down.  This place was amazingly delicious.  The fish itself was very large, probably the length of my forearm.  The breading was thin and light, and not shiny from grease.  The taste was over the top that it didn't need any sauce to make it edible, however, their tarter is freshly made, so even that had an outstanding taste you just cant pass  it up.  Half way done, I was already stuffed, but it was so good I couldn't stop eating!  Even the fries were good.The only problem was the fact that take away is so much cheaper that we decided to take it to go, however it's difficult to walk and enjoy at the same time.  Specially in the middle of winter with a very brisk wind and there is no where near the area to just sit and enjoy the food. We ended up eating in the cold (luckily the food was so hot that it off set how cold I felt) against the side of a building.  Even with this balancing act of ketchup, fries, fish and tarter sauce in a paper cone while walking in the cold, I would most defiantly go back and do it all over again.BOTTOM LINE: must go!!! the fish and chips are delicious! only problem is take away is so much cheaper it's hard to want to sit down and pay the extra price, which means you must be good at multitasking with eating and walking.

Wzk8x2N5zZlWnbr1R11nBQ.text: My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place as it was between our rental-car drop off and our hotel. It was packed on a Thursday night around 7 PM, and we waited about 15 minutes for a table. As soon as we were comfortably seated at a four-top, the hostess asked us to move to a cramped two-top next to a mother and child; my boyfriend refused, as the hostess had already seated us at the four-top. Also, we're not fond of other people's children. The hostess was kind of pissy about it, so I'm taking away a star for that. Otherwise, this was a great place -- a casual fish-and-chips place (though it also offered broiled options), with excellent wine, at a good price.

INeX-SgHUBpzEOUirt8S9A.text: Thanks to some London foodies' recommendations on Tripadvisor, my husband and I had a chance to try this place. By far it is the best fish 'n chips we had in London near Bloomsbury! You can tell right away that most of the customers are locals from the area and not many of tourists (at least for the night we were there), That was a very good sign to us. It was very packed so do expect that it will take longer for the food to come up. My husband ordered baked potato pie with smoked Haddock (14 BGP)  and I just ordered a regular cod fish 'n chips(18 GBP). The fish was fried to perfection and you can choose to have it breaded in batter or matzo flakes. The fish is moist inside the breaded batter and I think the regular size is more than enough for most lady customers. There are a few tiny bones in the fish but it didn't bother us at all. The chips (aka french fries) are decent but a little bit on the soggy side; not sure if it's because they are so busy the night we were there. My husband LOVED smoke haddock. It was super delicious!!! He loved the creaminess of the potato that was layered above the smoked haddock. You can taste the smokey flavor of the fish throughout the dish. I also ordered a side order of French bread and butter. The bread came slightly toasted and the butter was whippy enough to spread on the bread easily. Green peas was also served and the portion was quite decent for 2 people (unless you are crazy about  green peas, you can probably finish it all). The service is decent/standard. You are not gonna get a too chatty waitress there I think, because they are just too busy.  I do think  they expect some tipping, which my husband and I weren't sure about doing until I come back and re-read our travel guidebook. Thus, based on the quality of food, 10-15% tips would be good to show your appreciation of the food. Lastly, they do have some great dessert menu; we would've tried the white chocolate creme brulee if we weren't stuffed from all the yummy courses we had...but we are definitely going back once again before we leave!

IUIpPb8_9oML2gxXJ2ag1g.text: Decent take away. Nothing spectacular, but a nice simple meal. Literally 1/3 the prices of the dine in option right next door.

nTowPJMcQJuGp1xGy45LpQ.text: North Sea Fish Restaurant is not upscale and has a cozy divey feel to it.We ordered two different kinds of fish & chips halibut and cod, mushy peas & Brussels sprouts. The fish was kinda greasy (not light & flaky), but the fries were awesome...I'm a sucker for good fries. I figured I had to try the Mushy Peas, since it seems to be a British thing (they tasted like mushy peas...surprised?), I wouldn't order them again, but I had to try them once. The Brussels sprouts were pretty good, steamed with butter on them. The restaurant had good tartar sauce & pleasant service.I don't think I would go back, especially since I've had enough fish & chips already for the 10 days I am in London, but a pretty decent place to get fish & chips if you are in the neighborhood. It's probably a better idea to get "take away" since it's much cheaper than eating in the actual restaurant.

mwcXvQsVDAlZLMKu4cKtsw.text: THE BEST The Freshest and absolutely most wonderful fish and chips in London.  First went here in 1974 and it is wonderful.   The takeaway is great and the service in the sit down restaurant could not be friendlier.It is very inexpensive and I have never had fresher scallops.

brkXMRQJgO0DIY30hmgDqQ.text: Cool and hip?  Nah...  Great place for fish and chips?  Yes...  Ok, so it's not the coolest place to go and seems somewhat outdated, but I guess that is part of its charm.  If you are like most American's wanting the fish and chips experience, save the time and just ask for the jumbo fish and chips.  The fish is fresh, cooked right and the chips are good. While everyone else seems to enjoy a beer with their plate, a glass of scotch whiskey does the trick as well.

RyTtV3jEk1mg7MxZysf1CA.text: Out-dated deco,the staff hardly speaks English and watch and stare as you eat your food. Don'tturn up within one hour or less to closing as it clearly annoys the waitresses,which reflects in the way you are treated. It can be only described as a poshchippy with terrible place mats. The food is actually really nice, good piecesof fish but almost double the price as the chip shop next door. Stronglyrecommend for the food from the chip shop next door, which is still part of therestaurant but you can leave straight away rather than eating your meal with aside order of judgement.

i3qzFv0cWTeF52TJNUKdUQ.text: Should have caught the takeaway for a better price, but enjoyed my first fish and chip experience. Not blown away, but did enjoy.

ATzvvAcpJkCHH0vtea59tA.text: for proper fish n' chips head to north sea fish.  i had the pleasure of devouring a plate of haddock and chips for lunch today.  a staple for my london colleagues, i was happy to have dined here for a belated birthday celebration.  i shared teh jumbo haddock witht eh bday gal and let me tell you friends it was plenty of food.  the fish is fresh and makes all the caloric thoughts of waistlines disappear.  soooo goood.the bday gal was once unsatisifed with the fish at the restauarnt when she ordered take out.  she wrote an email and they apologized and asked her to come back on them.  second time was a charm, and they have had her biz since.  that's what i call service!!!

7l1JJJDI2pe0ZoFkKBLsVA.text: I've been coming here for years when in London, though only to the take away shop next to the proper restaurant.Summary:--high quality--take away is inexpensive--friendly service--a few spots for eating on the premises while standing

_9Bq8ixedJkX6KPdqisleg.text: I did order the jumbo size and it was very large, and the quality is good but I can't believe they charge over 18 pounds for their cheapest fish and chips (cod) and a beer. Service was poor, but that's typical for London.

_PmyJoaTiIMY39VifqQYwg.text: I have eaten here several times on my trips to the UK and got take out on 12/03/10.  Some of the best and most reasonably priced fish and chips around.  They buy their  fresh fish each morning at the Billingsgate Market.  They cooked the haddock right on the spot for me.  Right Ho!  I took the order to go back to my hotel and the food was still fresh, hot, and delicious.  Russell Square would be the closest Underground Station.  KIngs Cross & St. Pancras Underground Station is also within walking distance.  Take out is much less expensive.  You can walk over to Russell Square Gardens and people watch.  Be careful the food is hot coming out of the fryer.

cyrPdDLWpQl16GaUCgHrpg.text: Excellent food - all fish, the full Monty, and the last traditional English restaurant in London. You can only continue doing the same thing for ever if it is nearly perfect.
